result.execSummary:
The defendant Jesse J. Bilder was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Jesse J. Bilder is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Jesse J. Bilder was found guilty of Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Defendant must sumbit DNA sample at Oneida County Jail - 
Court does not order costs/forfeiture due to defendant not contesting the 4 civil forfeiture actions

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jesse J. Bilder

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Jesse J. Bilder in court with attorney Patrick Howard Finlan.  Michael William Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
11:43
Calling 15cv254-257-- as part of global resolution -Defendant does NOT contest forfeitures-  DA to do orders for forfeiture of items seized- 
State moves to amend count 1 to mis possession and dismiss count 2- Granted -Plea questionnaire filed -   Court reads on waiver of rights and tendering plea. Waiver free and voluntary. Court finds that a factual basis for the plea exists and finds defendant guilty
Schiek/Finlan/Court statement to sentencing - 
Court will not order costs/fines due to seizure of properties, and money- but defendant must pay submit DNA sample- 
  The court informs defendant of right to request expungement of the DNA under Wis. Stat. 165.77(4).
Appeal rights given
Pre-trial conference on April 12, 2016 at 11:30 am.

11:05 a.m. Defendant Jesse J. Bilder in court with attorney Patrick Howard Finlan.  Steven Mitchell Michlig appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Written Waiver of Preliminary Hearing filed. Defendant waives preliminary hearing. Waiver free and voluntary. Court finds that probable cause exists and binds over. State files Information - Finlan in receipt - waives reading - enters not guilty pleas to both counts. Bail continued. Adj 11:08 a.m.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for February 16, 2016 at 02:30 pm.
11:09 am. 15cv254, 15cv255, 15cv256 and 15cv257. Defendant Jesse J. Bilder in court with attorney Patrick Howard Finlan.  Steven Mitchell Michlig appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Michlig statement that civil forfeitures are before Judge Bloom - parties are requesting that civil matters to track with criminal - State moves to transfer to Branch 1. Hearings on civil matters set on February 3, 2016-request that hearing be cancelled and matters track with 15cf242.  Finlan statement that written answers have been filed in civil action - Counsel stipulates and agrees to waive statutory time frame in civil matters to allow civil to track with criminal matters. Court explains procedure to defendant - defendant in agreement to waiver of time limits. Intra circuit transfer may be appropriate at a later date but not at this time. Adj. 11:12 a.m.
States Reply to Discovery  and State's Demand for Discovery  - includes cover letter

2:46 p.m. Defendant Jesse J. Bilder in court with attorney Patrick Howard Finlan.  Steven Mitchell Michlig appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  In receipt of complaint, waive reading -set for preliminary hearing - Time limits waived
Bail continued  Preliminary hearing scheduled for January 8, 2016 at 11:00 am.

3:21 p.m. Defendant Jesse J. Bilder in court.  Steven Mitchell Michlig appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant states he thought attorney Finaln would be here - he contacted Attorney Finlan's office and was told Attorney Finlan was unavailable today and to request adjourned appearance. Adj. 3:23 p.m.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for December 14, 2015 at 02:30 pm.

2:16 p.m. Defendant Jesse J. Bilder in court.  Jodie L. Bednar appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant states he is not eligible for PD - has meeting with Finlan -  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for November 23, 2015 at 02:30 pm. Bail continued. Adj. 2:19 p.m.

records.descr: Pet for appointment counsel,affidavit of indigency

records.addlTxt: 1:21 p.m. Defendant Jesse J. Bilder in court, via video, in custody.  Steven Mitchell Michlig appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  In receipt of complaint, right to counsel - defendant will contact PD's office,  Michlig statement to bail - Court sets $  bond  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for October 19, 2015 at 02:30 pm. Adj. 1:25 p.m.
